metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9948 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
urllib in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 supports the local_file: scheme, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms that blacklist file: URIs, as demonstrated by triggering a urllib.urlopen('local_file:///etc/passwd') call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.16-2
python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.16-2').
